page.title: 08SELF-SUFFICIENCY
page.content: A{small-holding}of {37 acres} originally part of the Lanhydrock Estate. The present owner, of 12 years standing, could not make a living except by farming intensively of which she does not approve.Hence it was opened 9 years ago as a {farm park} where visitors can see a small farm worked by traditional methods. It is open mid-May until the end of September, 6 days a week and attracts an average of 180 people a day.It is advertised locally in newspapers,on television and in tourist information centres. The only crop is hay, animal feed being bought from a neighbour. Milk cannot be sold,as there is no tanker access,but is used to prepare dairy products which are sold in the farm shop and the skimmed milk fed to pigs.
